meanings.meaning: 1. to attach; to join; to connect; to add; to append; to affix; to stick; to glue; to fasten; to sew on; to apply (ointment); to put against Usually written using kana aloneおまえの上着は私の勘定につけておきなさい。Put your coat on my account.
2. to furnish (a house with) Usually written using kana alone自宅を改築する際に、この部屋にだけ防音設備と内鍵を付けたんだ。When my home had an extension built I only had this room fitted with soundproofing and an internal lock.
3. to wear; to put on Usually written using kana alone鎧をつけている人は、転ぶと大きな音がする。He who wears armor falls with a big crash!
4. to keep a diary; to make an entry Usually written using kana alone彼女は昔、日記を付けていたが今はつけていない。She used to keep a diary, but she no longer does.
5. to appraise; to set (a price) Usually written using kana aloneあの店では商品を値下げして値段がつけてある。They mark down goods at that shop.
6. to allot; to budget; to assign Usually written using kana alone
7. to bring alongside Usually written using kana alone
8. to place (under guard or doctor) Usually written using kana alone警官はその男をつけた。The policeman followed him.
9. to follow (someone); to shadow; to tail; to stalk Usually written using kana alone
10. to load; to give (courage to) Usually written using kana alone
11. to keep (an eye on) Usually written using kana alone
12. to establish (relations or understanding) Usually written using kana alone
13. to turn on (a light) Usually written using kana alone, See also 点けるトムがテレビをつけたとたんにヒューズがとんだ。No sooner had Tom turned on the TV than the fuse blew.
14. to produce flowers (of a plant); to produce fruit Usually written using kana alone私の木は少し花をつけたが実はならなかった。My tree had a few blossoms but no fruit.
15. to do intensely; to do fiercely; to do strongly Usually written using kana alone, See also 怒鳴りつける, after -masu stem of verb
16. to be used to (doing); to be accustomed to Usually written using kana alone, after -masu stem of verb
着ける 【つける】、附ける 【つける】
附ける: Rarely-used kanji form.

2. to furnish (a house with) Usually written using kana alone自宅を改築する際に、この部屋にだけ防音設備と内鍵を付けたんだ。When my home had an extension built I only had this room fitted with soundproofing and an internal lock.
3. to wear; to put on Usually written using kana alone鎧をつけている人は、転ぶと大きな音がする。He who wears armor falls with a big crash!
4. to keep a diary; to make an entry Usually written using kana alone彼女は昔、日記を付けていたが今はつけていない。She used to keep a diary, but she no longer does.
5. to appraise; to set (a price) Usually written using kana aloneあの店では商品を値下げして値段がつけてある。They mark down goods at that shop.
6. to allot; to budget; to assign Usually written using kana alone
7. to bring alongside Usually written using kana alone
8. to place (under guard or doctor) Usually written using kana alone警官はその男をつけた。The policeman followed him.
9. to follow (someone); to shadow; to tail; to stalk Usually written using kana alone
10. to load; to give (courage to) Usually written using kana alone
11. to keep (an eye on) Usually written using kana alone
12. to establish (relations or understanding) Usually written using kana alone
13. to turn on (a light) Usually written using kana alone, See also 点けるトムがテレビをつけたとたんにヒューズがとんだ。No sooner had Tom turned on the TV than the fuse blew.
14. to produce flowers (of a plant); to produce fruit Usually written using kana alone私の木は少し花をつけたが実はならなかった。My tree had a few blossoms but no fruit.
15. to do intensely; to do fiercely; to do strongly Usually written using kana alone, See also 怒鳴りつける, after -masu stem of verb
16. to be used to (doing); to be accustomed to Usually written using kana alone, after -masu stem of verb
着ける 【つける】、附ける 【つける】
附ける: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: Put your coat on my account.
When my home had an extension built I only had this room fitted with soundproofing and an internal lock.
He who wears armor falls with a big crash!
She used to keep a diary, but she no longer does.
They mark down goods at that shop.
The policeman followed him.
No sooner had Tom turned on the TV than the fuse blew.
My tree had a few blossoms but no fruit.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to be attached; to be connected with; to adhere; to stick; to cling ボイラは湯あかがびっしりついた。The boiler was heavily scaled.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to remain imprinted; to scar; to stain; to dye それらの牛には焼き印がついている。The cattle are marked with brands.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to bear (fruit, interest, etc.)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to be acquired (of a habit, ability, etc.); to increase (of strength, etc.) 彼は妻が死んで以来酒を飲む癖がついた。He has taken to drinking since the death of his wife.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to take root

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to accompany; to attend; to follow; to study with お風呂はついてますか。Does it have a bathroom?

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to side with; to belong to 彼はその討論で反対派に付いた。He sided with the opposition group in the argument.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to possess; to haunt See also 憑く

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to be lit; to catch fire; to ignite; to be turned on (of a light, appliance, etc.) See also 点くテレビがつきません。The TV won't turn on.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 10. to be settled; to be resolved; to be decided

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 11. to be given (of a name, price, etc.)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 12. to be sensed; to be perceived

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ku' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 13. to be lucky from 運がつく
14. to become (a state, condition, etc.) See also 付く づく, after -masu stems, onomatopoeic and mimetic words
附く 【つく】
附く: Rarely-used kanji form.

meanings.meaning: 1. to discover; to find (e.g. an error in a book); to come across; to detect; to spot 彼女は物置の中で偶然いくつかの古文書を見つけた。She came across some old documents in the closet.
2. to locate; to find (e.g. something missing); to find fault 僕の弱点を見つけさせないぞ。You won't find my weak point.
3. to be used to seeing; to be familiar with See also 見慣れる
